Package ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.diary.core

Record Class Note

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.diary.core.Note
Record Components:
heading - a title
text - contents
date - a date of creation
public record Note(String heading, String text, ZonedDateTime date) extends Record
A note class providing a basic functionality to handle small writings with a specified heading() and text(). Designed to be instantiated and usually instantiated internally by Diary.

The contract consists of filtering predicates, such as containsInHeading(String), after(ZonedDateTime)and before(ZonedDateTime), and toString(), representing this note acceptably for a Diary.

See Also:
  • Diary
  • ZonedDateTime

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static Note create(String heading, String contents)
      Creates a new instance of Note with a specified heading and contents and current date of creation (latter is provided by ZonedDateTime.now()).
      Parameters:
      heading - a string literal that specifies a heading of an entry
      contents - a string literal that specifies a text of an entry
      Returns:
      a new instance of Note

    • containsInHeading

      public boolean containsInHeading(String keyword)
      Returns true if this Note heading containsInHeading a specified keyword. Keyword is treated as a sequence of characters, so this method doesn't search for words but for the occurrence of one.
      Parameters:
      keyword - a string to be found in the heading of this Note
      Returns:
      true if this Note heading containsInHeading a specified keyword.

      true if this Note was created before a specified date.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a pretty representation of this note. An example of a format is presented below.
      Heading: title
      Text: contents
      ------------
      Date: Tue, 27 Dec 2022 22:21:52 +0700
      Specified by:
      toString in class Record
      Returns:
      a pretty representation of this note

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
